sourceText: Millions of children face interruptions with schooling and often feel isolated from friends and peers.
text: Izigidi zezingane zihlangabezana nokuphazamiseka bese zizizwa zibandlululekile ebanganini nontanga.

sourceText: This tip is about learning through play – something that can be fun for all ages!
text: Leli cebiso limayelana nokufunda ngokudlala - into engathokozelwa abantu beminyaka yonke!

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: Telling stories.
text: Ukuxoxa izindaba.

sourceText: Tell your children a story from your own childhood.
text: Xoxela izingane zakho indaba kusukela ebuntwaneni bakho.

sourceText: Ask your children to tell you a story.
text: Cela izingane zakho ukuba zikuxoxele indaba.

sourceText: Make up a new story together starting with “Once upon a time…” Each person adds a new sentence to the story.
text: Yenzani indaba entsha ndawonye niqale ngokuthi “Kwasukasukela…” Umuntu ngamunye uzokwengeza umusho endabani.

sourceText: Act out a favorite story or movie – older children can even direct younger ones while learning responsibility.
text: Lingisani indaba eniyithandayo noma ifilimu – izingane ezindala zingase ziqondise ezincane njengoba zifunda umsebenzi.

sourceText: Change the object!
text: Shintsha into!

sourceText: Every day household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games.
text: Izinto ezisetshenziswa nsuku zonke ekhaya ezinjengemishanelo, amamophu, noma izikhafu kungaba yizinto zokuzijabulisa zemidlalo.

sourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be.
text: Beka into phakathi negumbi nomshanelo futhi uma kukhona onombono, agxumele phakathi ese ebonisa wonke umuntu ukuthi leyonto kungaba yini.

sourceText: For example, a broom might become a horse, microphone, or even a guitar!
text: Ngokwesibonelo, umshanelo ungaba yihhashi, umbhobho, noma isiginci!

sourceText: Movement games.
text: Imidlalo yokunyakaza.

sourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs. First person does a dance move and everyone else copies. Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Qamba ubuciko bomdanso wengoma ethandwa yizingane zakho. Umuntu wokuqala wenza umdanso bese bonke abanye bayamlingisa. Wonke umuntu uyashintshana ngokuba ngumholi.

sourceText: “Challenge” who can do the most toe touches, jumping jacks, or laps around the room in a minute.
text: "Phosa inselelo" ubani okwazi ukuthinta izinzwane kakhulu, ukugxuma, noma  ukugxumagxuma egunjini ngomzuzu.

sourceText: “Mirror” each other’s facial expressions, movements, sounds. One person can start as the leader and then switch. Try it with no leaders!
text: “Isibuko" ubuso bomunye nomunye, ukunyakaza, imisindo. Umuntu oyedwa angaqala njengomholi bese niyashintshana. Kuzameni ngaphandle komholi!

sourceText: Freeze dance: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances. When the music stops, everyone must freeze. Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Umdanso wokunganyakazi: Dlala umculo noma othile acule, bese wonke umuntu uyadansa. Uma umculo uma, wonke umuntu kumele ame anganyakazi. Umuntu ozogcina ukuma uba yijaji ngokulandelayo.

sourceText: Animal dance: Same as above but when the music stops, call out a name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: Umdanso wezilwane: Njengasenhla kodwa uma umculo uma, biza igama lesilwane, bese wonke umuntu kufanele abe yileso silwane.

sourceText: Types of play.
text: Izinhlobo zemidlalo.

sourceText: Learning through Play
text: Ukufunda Ngokudlala

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Ngesikhathi se-COVID-19

sourceText: tips from WHO
text: amacebiso avela kwa-WHO

sourceText: tips from UNICEF
text: amacebiso avela kwa-UNICEF

sourceText: other languages
text: ezinye izilimi

sourceText: evidence-base
text: Isisekelo sobufakazi

sourceText: Singing.
text: Ukucula.

sourceText: Singing songs to your baby or young child helps develop language.
text: Ukuculela usana noma ingane yakho encane amaculo kusiza ukuthuthukisa ulimi.

sourceText: Play or sing a song, and the first one to guess it right becomes the next leader.
text: Dlala noma ucule ingoma, futhi owokuqala ukuyiqagela kahle uzoba ngumholi olandelayo.

sourceText: Make up a song about handwashing or physical distancing. Add dance movements!
text: Yenza ingoma ngokugeza izandla noma ukuqhelelana. Faka iminyakazo yokudansa!

sourceText: Memory game.
text: Umdlalo wenkumbulo.

sourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to...” (e.g, go to the park).
text: Umuntu wokuqala uthi, “Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizo..." (isib, ngizoya epaki).

sourceText: Second person adds to first person, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”.
text: Umuntu wesibili uzokwengeza kowokuqala, "Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizoya epaki futhi...(isib., ngivakashele umngane wami omkhulu)".

sourceText: Each person adds to the previous trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Umuntu ngamunye wengeza kokudlule ezama ukucabanga ngezinto ezijabulisayo angazenza uma kuphela i-COVID-19.

sourceText: You can change this to any scenario in the future (e.g., when I see my friends).
text: Ungakushintsha lokhu kube yinoma yisiphi isimo ngokuzayo (isib., uma ngibona abangane bami).

sourceText: There are many different types of play that can be both fun AND educational.
text: Kunezinhlobo eziningi zemidlalo ezingaba mnandi FUTHI zifundise.

sourceText: Language, numbers, objects, drama, and music games give children opportunities to explore and express themselves in a safe and fun way.
text: Izilimi, izinombolo, izinto, imidlalo yeshashalazi, nemidlalo yomculo kunikeza izingane amathuba okuhlola nokuziveza ngendlela ephephile nejabulisayo.

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi

sourceText: We love our children and teenagers, but stress from caregiving, money, and COVID-19 can make us angry.
text: Siyazithanda izingane nentsha yethu, kodwa ingcindezi evela ekubanakekeleni, emalini, kanye ne-COVID-19 kungasenza sithukuthele.

sourceText: Here is how we can maintain control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: Nakhu esingakwenza ukugcina nokulawula intukuthelo yethu ukuze singalimazi abanye.

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: Stop the river at the source.The same things usually make us get stressed and angry every time.What makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.Look after yourself. Try the “Take a Pause” and “Managing Stress” resource sheets for ideas.
text: Nqanda umfula emthonjeni.Izinto ezifanayo zisenza sicindezeleke futhi sithukuthele ngaso sonke isikhathi.Yini ekwenza uthukuthele? Kwenzeka nini? Ingabe ujwayele ukusabela kanjani?Nqanda intukuthelo kwasekuqaleni. Lala noma uphumule uma ukhathele. Zama ukudla okuthile uma ulambile. Cela ukwesekwa ngothile uma uzizwa unomzwangedwa.Zinakekele. Zama amaphepha ezinsiza athi “Thatha ikhefu” nelithi “Ukulawula Ukucindezeleka” ukuthola amacebiso.

sourceText: Take care of yourself.
text: Zinakekele.

sourceText: We all need to connect. Talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day.
text: Sonke siyadinga ukuxhuma. Xoxa nabangane, umndeni, kanye namanethiwekhi okusekela nsuku zonke.

sourceText: Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
text: Nciphisa ukuphuza utshwala noma ungaphuzi nhlobo, ikakhulukazi uma izingane zivukile.

sourceText: Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
text: Ingabe unazo izikhali noma izinto ezingasetshenziswa ukulimaza abanye? Zivalele, zifihle noma zikhiphe ekhaya.

sourceText: It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
text: Kulungile ukuba izingane zakho zihlale kwenye indawo ephephile noma endaweni lapho zingathola khona usizo.

sourceText: Take a break.
text: Thatha ikhefu.

sourceText: When you start feeling angry, take a 20-second cool down. Breathe in and out slowly 5 times before you speak or move.
text: Uma uqala ukuzizwa uthukuthele, yehlisa umoya imizuzwana engama-20. Donsa umoya bese uwukhipha kancane izikhathi ezinhlanu ngaphambi kokuba ukhulume noma unyakaze.

sourceText: Go somewhere else for 10 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside.
text: Hamba uye kwenye indawo imizuzu eyi-10 ukuze ukwazi ukulawula imizwa yakho. uma unendawo ephephile ngaphandle, hamba uye ngaphandle.

sourceText: If you are getting angry because your baby won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe location, like a crib, and walk away for a bit. Check on your baby every 5-10 minutes.
text: Uma ucasulwa ukuthi ingane yakho ayiyeki ukukhala, KULUNGILE ukuyishiya ilele ngomhlane endaweni ephephile, njengasembhedeni wayo, bese uhamba isikhashana. Hlola ingane yakho njalo emizuzwini engu-5-10.

sourceText: The COVID-19 crisis isn’t forever – we just have to get through it now…one day at a time.
text: Inkinga ye-COVID-19 ngeke ihlale unomphela – sidinga nje ukudlula kuyo manje…usuku ngalunye ngesikhathi.

sourceText: Brain science shows that if you control your anger or do something positive you increase your child’s brain development.
text: Isayensi yobuchopho ibonisa ukuthi uma ulawula intukuthelo yakho noma wenza okuthile okuhle wandisa ukukhula kwengqondo yengane yakho.

sourceText: Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Ziqhenye ngawe uma ukwazile ukukwenza!

sourceText: That’s real success!
text: Leyo yimpumelelo yangempela!

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Ngesikhathi se-COVID-19

sourceText: When We Get Angry
text: Uma Sithukuthela

sourceText: tips from WHO
text: amacebiso avela kwa-WHO

sourceText: tips from UNICEF
text: amacebiso avela kwa-UNICEF

sourceText: other languages
text: ezinye izilimi

sourceText: evidence-base
text: Isisekelo sobufakazi

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi

sourceText: Keeping your family healthy and safe from COVID-19 can feel even harder when you live in crowded conditions.
text: Ukugcina umndeni wakho uphilile futhi uphephile kwi-COVID-19 kungezwakala kunzima kakhulu uma uhlala ezindaweni eziminyene.

sourceText: There are things you can do to make this easier for your family.
text: Kunezinto ongazenza ukwenza lokhu kube lula emndenini wakho.

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: Keep using these tips
text: Qhubeka usebenzisa lamacebiso.

sourceText: Help your children with physical distancing.
text: Siza izingane zakho ngokuziqhelelanisa kwabanye.

sourceText: Explain to your children that they have an important job of keeping themselves and their community healthy by temporarily physically distancing from others.
text: Chazela izingane zakho ukuthi zinomsebezi obalulekile wokuzigcina zona nomphakathi wazo uphilile ngokuziqhelelanisa okwesikhashana nabanye.

sourceText: Show them extra positive attention when they make an effort to practice safe physical distancing from others.
text: Babonise ukunaka okwengeziwe uma benza imizamo yokuzijwayeza ukuziqhelelanisa nabanye.

sourceText: Make handwashing and hygiene fun!
text: Yenza ukugeza izandla kanye nokuhlanzeka kube mnandi!

sourceText: It might be hard to find soap and water, but practicing good hygiene is more important now than ever.
text: Kungaba nzima ukuthola insipho namanzi, kodwa ukwenza umkhuba wokuhlanzeka kubaluleke kakhulu manje kunakuqala.

sourceText: Try to wash all family members’ hands as often as possible with soap and water.
text: Zama ukugeza izandla zawo wonke amalungu omndeni kaningi ngangokunokwenzeka ngensipho namanzi.

sourceText: Help children teach each other how to wash their hands with soap and water.
text: Siza izingane ukuba zifundisane ukugeza izandla ngensipho namanzi.

sourceText: Encourage children to avoid touching their face.
text: Khuthaza izingane ukuba zigweme ukuthinta ubuso bazo.

sourceText: Keeping positive, having a routine and trying to get some one-to-one time with each child when you can will help you manage your children’s behaviours and your feelings.
text: Ukuhlala unomqondo oqondile, ube nenqubo eqondile ejwayelekile nokuzama ukuthola isikhathi somuntu ngamunye nengane ngayinye uma ungakwazi kungakusiza ukuba ulawule indlela abaziphatha ngayo kanye nemizwa yakho.

sourceText: Take a Pause.
text: Yima Kancane.

sourceText: You might not have space to yourself to deal with all the stress and emotions you are feeling.
text: Kungenzeka ungabi nesikhathi sakho sokuba ubhekane nakho konke ukucindezeleka nemizwa oyizwayo.

sourceText: Notice when you are feeling stressed or upset and take a pause…even three deep breaths can make a difference!
text: Qaphela uma uzizwa ucindezelekile noma ucasukile bese uyema kancane…ngisho nokudonsa umoya ngokujulile kathathu kungenza umehluko!

sourceText: Well done! Millions of families find that this helps.
text: Wenze kahle! Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi lokhu kuyasiza.

sourceText: Exercise daily.
text: Zivocavoce zonke izinsuku.

sourceText: Encourage children to think of activities they can do to exercise while avoiding contact with people who do not already live in your immediate space.
text: Khuthaza izingane ukuba zicabange ngezinto ezingazenza ukuzivocavoca ngesikhathi zigwema ukusondelana nabanye abantu abangahlali lapho zihlala khona.

sourceText: Jumping activities, dancing or running in circles can be fun!
text: Imidlalo yokugxuma, ukudansa noma ukugijima benze indilinga ingaba mnandi!

sourceText: Share the load.
text: Yabelana ngomthwalo.

sourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult in cramped spaces, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.
text: Ukunakekela izingane kanye namanye amalungu omndeni kungaba nzima ezindaweni eziminyene, kodwa kuba lula uma kwabelanwa ngemithwalo yemfanelo.

sourceText: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.
text: Zamani ukwaba imisebenzi yasekhaya, ukunakekela izingane, kanye neminye imisebenzi ngokulinganayo phakathi kwamalungu omndeni.

sourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.
text: Yakha isimiso sesikhathi "sokungena" nesikhathi "sokuphuma" nabanye abantu abadala ekhaya lakho.

sourceText: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
text: Kulungile ukucela usizo uma uzizwa ukhathele noma ucindezelekile ukuze uthathe ikhefu.

sourceText: tips from WHO
text: amacebiso avela kwa-WHO

sourceText: tips from UNICEF
text: amacebiso avela kwa-UNICEF

sourceText: other languages
text: ezinye izilimi

sourceText: evidence-base
text: Isisekelo sobufakazi

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Ngesikhathi se-COVID-19

sourceText: Parenting in Crowded Homes and Communities
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Emakhaya Nasemiphakathini Eminyene

sourceText: Keep staying safe.
text: Qhubeka nokuzinakekela.

sourceText: Limit those leaving and returning to your immediate living space to as few and as infrequent as possible.
text: Nciphisa labo abahamba babuye kwakho ngenani eliphansi futhi kungenzeki njalo ngangokunokwenzeka.

sourceText: Know the COVID-19 rules about what you can and can’t do in your area.
text: Yazi imithetho ye-Covid-19 ngongakwenza nongeke ukwenze endaweni yakho.

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi

sourceText: Share with colleagues, friends and family | Spread the word | Keep children safe online.
text: Yabelana nosebenza nabo, abangane nomndeni | Tshela abanye | Gcina izingane ziphephile ku-inthanethi.

sourceText: Keep your child safe with open communication.
text: Gcina ingane yakho iphephile ngokukhulumisana ngokukhululekile.

sourceText: Tell your children that if they experience something online that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
text: Tshela izingane zakho ukuthi uma zihlangabezana nokuthile ku-inthanethi okubenza bacasuke, bangakhululeki, noma besabe, bangakhuluma nawe futhi ngeke uthukuthele noma ubajezise.

sourceText: Be alert to signs of distress. Notice if your child is being withdrawn, upset, secretive, or obsessed with online activities.
text: Qaphela izimpawu zokucindezeleka. Qaphela uma ingane yakho ihoxile, idumele, inezimfihlo, noma ikhathazeke kakhulu ngezinto ezenziwa ku-inthanethi.

sourceText: Create trusting relationships and open communication through positive support and encouragement.
text: Yakha ubudlelwano bokwethembana nokukhulumisana okukhululekile ngokweseka okuhle nokukhuthaza.

sourceText: Note that every child is unique and may use different ways to communicate.Take time to adjust your message for your child’s needs.
text: Qaphela ukuthi zonke izingane zihlukile futhi zingasebenzisa izindlela zokukhulumisana ezihlukile. Thatha isikhathi ukulungisa umlayezo wakho ngokwezidingo zengane yakho.

sourceText: For example, children with learning disabilities, may require information in simple formats.
text: Ngokwesibonelo, izingane ezinenkinga yokufunda, zingadinga ulwazi olwenziwe lwaba lula.

sourceText: Children and teens are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps them reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages them to continue with their lives… but it also presents risks and dangers.
text: Izingane nentsha manje sezichitha isikhathi esiningi ku-inthanethi. Ukuxhuma kubasiza ukuba banciphise umthelela we-Covid-19 futhi kubakhuthaza ukuba baqhubeke nezimpilo zabo... kodwa futhi kuphinde kuveze izingozi.

sourceText: Cyberbullying from peers and strangers.
text: Ukuxhashazwa nge-inthaneti ontanga nabantu abangabazi.

sourceText: Spend time with your child or teen online.Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.Talk to your teen on how to report inappropriate content (see below).Common Sense Mediahas great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.
text: Chitha isikhathi nengane noma osemusha wakho ku-inthanethi.Hlolani ndawonye izingosi, izinkundla zokuxhumana, imidlalo, kanye nama-app.Xoxa nosemusha wakho ngokuthi angabika kanjani okuqukethwe okungalungile (bheka ngezansi).Umqondo Wezinkundla Zokuxhumanaunezeluleko ezinhle ngama-apps, imidlalo kanye nokokuzijabulisa kwabantu beminyaka ehlukene.

sourceText: Report online violence against children:
text: Bika udlame olwenziwa ezinganeni nge-inthanethi:

sourceText: Other resources:
text: Ezinye izinsiza:

sourceText: Online Risks.
text: Izingozi Eziku-Inthanethi.

sourceText: Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: Abantu abadala abafunana nezingane ngezinjongo zocansi ezinkundleni zokuxhumana, kwezemidlalo, kanye nasezinkundleni zemiyalezo.

sourceText: Harmful content – violence, misogyny, xenophobia, inciting suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography etc.
text: Okuqukethwe okuyingozi - udlame, inzondo ebhekiswe kubantu besifazane, ukucwaswa kwabokufika, ukukhuthaza ukuzibulala kanye nokuzilimaza, ulwazi olungelina iqiniso, izithombe zocansi njll.

sourceText: Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: Intsha yabelana ngemininingwane yabo yomuntu siqu kanye nezithombe zocansi noma amavidiyo ayo.

sourceText: Child Helpline
text: Inombolo Yocingo Yosizo Lwezingane

sourceText: INHOPE Hotlines
text: Izinombolo Zocingo ze-INHOPE

sourceText: IWF portals
text: Izingosi ze-IWF

sourceText: safety booklet
text: incwajana yezokuphepha

sourceText: unicef
text: i-unicef

sourceText: other languages
text: ezinye izilimi

sourceText: evidence-base
text: Isisekelo sobufakazi

sourceText: Keeping Children Safe Online
text: Ukugcina Abantwana Bephephile Ku-Inthanethi

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Ngesikhathi se-COVID-19

sourceText: Create healthy and safe online habits.Involve yourchildorteenin creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.Create device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.
text: Yakha imikhuba enempilo nephephile ye-inthanethi.Hilela inganeyakhonomaosemushaekwakheni izivumelwano zobuchwepheshe bomndeni ngokusebenzisa izinsiza-kuxhumana ngokunempilo.Yenza izikhala nezikhathi ezingenazo izinsiza-kuxhumana ekhaya lakho (zokudla, zokudlala, zomsebenzi wesikole, kanye nezokulala).Siza ingane yakho ifunde ukugcina imininingwane yomuntu siqu iyimfihlo, ikakhulukazi kubantu engabazi â€“ abanye abantu abakona lokho abathi bayikho!Khumbuza izingane zakho ukuthi okufakwa ku-inthanethi kuhlala kugcineke ku-inthanethi (imiyalezo, izithombe, kanye namavidiyo).Qikelela ukuthi ugada isikhathi sezingane ku-inthanethi, kuhlanganise amakhompyutha, amafoni anobuchwepheshe, kanye namatheblethi.

sourceText: Tech fixes to protect your children online.Set upparental controls.Turn onSafeSearchon your browser.Set up strictprivacy settingson online apps and games.Cover webcams when not in use.
text: Ukulungiswa kobuchwepheshe ukuze usize ukuvikela abantwana bakho ku-inthanethi.Sethaizilawuli zabazali.VulaSesha Ngokuphephileesipheqululini sakho.Setha strictaqinilekuma-apps nemidlalo ye-inthanethi.Mboza amakhamera ekhompyutha uma ungawasebenzisi.

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi

sourceText: Well done! Millions of families find that this helps.
text: Wenze kahle! Izigidi zemindeni zithola ukuthi lokhu kuyasiza.

sourceText: Millions are stressed about money because of COVID-19. It can make us feel exhausted, angry, and distracted.
text: Izigidi zikhathazeke ngemali ngenxa ye-COVID-19. Kungasenza sizizwe sikhathele, sithukuthele, futhi siphazamisekile.

sourceText: Children or teenagers asking for things can cause arguments. It can help them a lot when we involve them with family budgeting.
text: Izingane noma intsha ecela izinto ingabangela izingxabano. Kungazisiza kakhulu uma sizihilela ezinhlelweni zomndeni zesabelomali.

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: What do we spend now?
text: Yini esiyisebenzisayo manje?

sourceText: Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
text: Thola isiqeshana sephepha (noma iphephandaba elidala noma ikhadibhodi) kanye nepeni.

sourceText: Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
text: Dweba izithombe zazo zonke izinto wena nomndeni wakho enichitha imali kuzo ngenyanga.

sourceText: Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
text: Bhala eceleni kwesithombe ngasinye ukuthi into ngayinye ibiza malini.

sourceText: Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text: Hlanganisa inani lemali enilisebenzisayo ngenyanga.

sourceText: Build your own budget.
text: Zakhele uhlelo lokusebenzisa imali.

sourceText: Find a bag of stones or anything with lots of bits. This is your money for the month.
text: Thola isikhwama samatshe noma okuthile okunezingcezu eziningi. Lokhu yimali yakho yenyanga.

sourceText: As a family, decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones on your picture.
text: Njengomndeni, vumelanani ukuthi yikuphi enizokusebenzisa kuphi, bese nibeka amatshe esithombeni senu.

sourceText: If you can save even a tiny amount for the future, or for an emergency – it is great.
text: Uma ungakwazi ukonga ngisho noma okuncane kwekusasa, noma kwezimo eziphuthumayo - kuhle lokho.

sourceText: Talk about needs and wants.
text: Khulumani ngezidingo kanye nezimfuno.

sourceText: Needs: Which things are important or must haves for your family to survive? (like food, soap to wash hands, needs for ill or disabled family members).
text: Izidingo: Yiziphi izinto ezibalulekile noma okumele nibe nazo ukuze umndeni wakho uphile? (njengokudla, insipho yokugeza izandla, izidingo zamalungu omndeni agulayo noma akhubazekile).

sourceText: Wants: Which things are nice to have but not essential?
text: Izimfuno: Yiziphi izinto okuhle ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekile?

sourceText: Discuss with your children what things you could try to spend less on as a family.
text: Xoxa nezingane zakho ukuthi yiziphi izinto eningazama ukusebenzisa imali encane kuzo njengomndeni.

sourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times.
text: Isabelomali yindlela esinquma ukuthi sizoyisebenziselani imali yethu, nangezikhathi ezinzima.

sourceText: Making a budget together helps children understand that we all need to make hard decisions in difficult times.
text: Ukwenza isabelomali ndawonye kusiza izingane ukuba ziqonde ukuthi sonke kumele sithathe izinqumo ezinzima ngezikhathi ezinzima.

sourceText: It also helps families to have enough at the end of the month, and borrow less.
text: Kubuye kusize imindeni ukuba ibe nokwanele ekupheleni kwenyanga, futhi baboleke kancane.

sourceText: Your government may be giving money, or food parcels to families during COVID-19.
text: Uhulumeni wakho kungenzeka ukuba uphana ngemali, noma amaphasela okudla emindenini ngesikhathi se-COVID-19.

sourceText: Ask about whether places in your community are giving support.
text: Buza ukuthi ingabe izindawo emphakathini wakho ziyanikeza yini ukweseka.

sourceText: There may be help you can get.
text: Kungaba nosizo ongaluthola.

sourceText: Involve children and teens in making a family budget.
text: Hilela izingane nentsha ekwenzeni isabelomali somndeni.

text: amacebiso avela kwa-WHO

sourceText: Family Budgeting in Times of Financial Stress

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi

sourceText: ClickHEREfor useful resources and support if you are experiencing violence at home
text: ChofozaLAPHAukuze uthole izinsiza nosizo uma uhlangabezana nodlame ekhaya

sourceText: When we model peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved.
text: Uma siveza ubudlelwano obunokuthula nobunothando, izingane zethu zizizwa zivikelekile futhi zithandwa kakhudlwana.

sourceText: Positive language, active listening, and empathy help maintain a peaceful and happy family environment under stressful times.
text: Ulimi olwakhayo, ukulalelisisa, kanye nozwela kusiza ukugcina ukuthula nenjabulo esimweni somndeni ngezikhathi ezinzima.

sourceText: Use positive language. It works!
text: Sebenzisa ulimi olwakhayo! Luyasebenza!

sourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”.
text: Tshela abanye ukuthi ufuna benzeni kunokuba ubatshele lokho ongafuni bakwenze: Esikhundleni sokuthi "Yeka ukumemeza," zama ukuthi "Ngicela ukhulumele phansi."

sourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference.
text: Ncoma abanye ukuze ubenze bazizwe bethokozelwa futhi bazizwe kahle ngabo ngokwabo. Amagama alula afana nokuthi, "Ngiyabonga ngokuqoqa ngemva kwesidlo sasebusuku," noma "Ngiyabonga ngokugada ingane" angenza umehluko omkhulu.

sourceText: Share the load.
text: Yabelana ngomthwalo.

sourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.
text: Ukunakekela abantwana kanye namanye amalungu omndeni kunzima, kodwa kuba lula uma imisebenzi ihlanganyelwa.

sourceText: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.
text: Zamani ukwaba imisebenzi yasekhaya, ukunakekela izingane, kanye neminye imisebenzi ngokulinganayo phakathi kwamalungu omndeni.

sourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.
text: Yakha isimiso sesikhathi "sokungena" nesikhathi "sokuphuma" nabanye abantu abadala ekhaya lakho.

sourceText: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
text: Kulungile ukucela usizo uma uzizwa ukhathele noma ucindezelekile ukuze uthathe ikhefu.

sourceText: Feeling stressed or angry?Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly five times. Then try to respond in a calmer way. Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.See Tip Sheets on “When We Get Angry” and “Keep Calm and Manage Stress”.
text: Uzizwa ucindezelekile noma uthukuthele?Zinike ikhefu lemizuzwana engu-10. Donsa umoya bese uyawukhipha kancane kahlanu. Bese uzama ukuphendula ngendlela ezolile. Izigidi zabazali zithi lokhu kuyasiza - KAKHULU.Khetha ukuthatha ikhefu ezingxabanweni uma ubona izingxabano zakheka, bese uya kwelinye igumbi noma phandle uma ukwazi.Bheka Iphepha Lamacebiso ku- “Lapho Sithukuthela” kanye ne- “Zola futhi Ulawule Ukucindezeleka”.

sourceText: Nice things to do together as a family.
text: Izinto ezinhle eningazenza ndawonye njengomndeni.

sourceText: Let each family member take turns choosing a whole family activity each day.
text: Ilungu ngalinye lomndeni malishintshane ngokukhetha umsebenzi womndeni wonke usuku ngalunye.

sourceText: Find ways to spend quality time alone with your partner and other adults in your home, too!
text: Thola izindlela zokuchitha isikhathi esizuzisayo nophathina wakho nabanye abantu abadala emndenini wakho, futhi!

sourceText: Be an empathetic active listener.
text: Yiba yisislaleli esilalelisayo esinozwela.

sourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you.
text: Lalela abanye uma bekhuluma nawe.

sourceText: Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying.
text: Vuleleka futhi ubabonise ukuthi uyakuzwa abakushoyo.

sourceText: It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”.
text: Kungasiza ukufingqa okuzwile ngaphambi kokuba uphendule: "Engikuzwa ukusho ukuthi...".

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: We are models for our kids.
text: Siyizibonelo ezinganeni zethu.

sourceText: How we talk and behave in front of our children is a big influence on how they behave too!
text: Indlela esikhuluma nesiziphatha ngayo phambi kwezingane zethu inomthelela omkhulu endleleni abaziphatha ngayo nabo!

sourceText: Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
text: Zama ukukhuluma ngomusa kuwo wonke umuntu emndenini, abantu abadala kanye nezingane.

sourceText: Bad communication between adults in the household can have a negative impact on our children.
text: Ukukhulumisana okongalungile phakathi kwabantu abadala ekhaya kungaba nomthelela omubi ezinganeni zethu.

sourceText: The more we practice modeling peaceful, loving relationships for our children, the more secure and loved they will feel.
text: Uma sizijwayeza ngokwengeziwe ukubonisa ubudlelwano obunokuthula, nothando ezinganeni zethu, ziyozizwa zivikeleke kakhulu futhi zithandwa.

sourceText: Family Harmony at Home
text: Ukuvumelana Komndeni Ekhaya
